question: Oh man, the other day I was looking at my old school pictures and couldn't help but feel nostalgic. I found this one photo from my high school graduation - class of '98! Can't believe it's been more than 20 years. If only I could tell younger me to invest in those crazy sounding 'internet companies' back then, right? Haha! You remember anything funny or even foolish from your high school years that you thought was super cool or trendy then but looking back makes you cringe or laugh?

comments.text: lol, '98 graduation? “you kids and your Spice Girls.” just teasing ya! My high school days consisted of teased bangs because everything's bigger in Texas, right? And... the horror... neon windbreakers. Yup, our version of 'cool'. Good grief, why did we think shoulder pads were the way to go? Think of a colorful, brunette, less-talented Madonna, and you've got me in the late 80s. Total cringe-fest. But yeah, to be fair to young me, it was the era, but still... what were we thinking? haha!

question: I've been thinking a lot about age and growing up recently. I mean, I remember when cellphones were these huge bricks and the only game you could play on them was Snake. And social media? It was practically nonexistent. If you think back, what was the first social media network you joined? Do you remember what age you were when you first became a part of the online community?

comments.text: oh those good old days! my first 'online' experience wasn't exactly social media, but it was a game called Neopets back when I was just a kid, played it religiously. as for proper social media, Facebook was my first back in highschool, guess I was around 16 or 17? way before IG or reddit etc. kinda felt like a big deal, having a fancy facebook profile. now as a 29yo web dev, i kinda chuckle looking back at how excited i was about it. btw, did i mention my job? i personally coded a social media site for a Swedish company. pretty neat, huh? ;)

question: I've been sorting through old pictures with my parents lately, and I came across some photos of me with my first Game Boy. I remember being absolutely hooked to it when Pokemon Red/Blue arrived. That was such a huge thing in my childhood. How about you, what was your obsession in childhood? Do you remember any specific toy or game that was popular during that time?

comments.text: Ah reminiscing childhood, huh? Those were the days... So, yeah, about that. I was completely enraptured by my Famicom. Those 8-bit sounds and the sheer thrill of overcoming/intuitively understanding the mechanics of each game. Totally got me hooked. And then there was this game - Dragon Quest III. Eiichiro Nakatsu, the genius. This game man, this game was a phenomenon back in my school days. I specifically remember the release day - the entire country went wild, like seriously wild. That's probably why I ended up a game developer now, haha. Nostalgic TIMESSSS!!

I remember, this sounds corny, but I used to try and convince my family I could do a kamehameha if I just concentrated hard enough. and that flip phones, man. really shows I'm not a teen anymore when a Motorola Razr was the coolest thing ever.

question: I remember eagerly waiting for the release of the first Harry Potter book when I was 12, and then binge-reading it in just about a day. Did you also grow up with Harry, Ron, and Hermione in the Gryffindor house, or was there another book or movie series that marked your childhood or teenage years?

comments.text: oh, the Harry Potter series was a big thing for my kids, they grew up with 'em and even i got hooked. But personally, when I was a teenager, it was all about "dirty dancing". Gotta admit, those were the times! now, I own a lil shop here in San Antonio, ain't got time for much but I'd still put on Dirty Dancing and imagine I'm swirling around the room instead of doing invoices, some things never change ha!

question: I remember the thrill of catching my first ever Pokemon in Pokemon Red on my game-boy when I was just a kid back in the day, picturing myself in a world of Pokemon, and that world manifesting for me in a device you could fit in your pocket was quite a thrill for 9-year-old me. It makes me wonder, for you, what was the first video game you played which completely absorbed you and why did it captivate you so much?

comments.text: oh, crikey! talk about a blast from the past. my earliest memory of being completely absorbed by a video game.. hmm.. has got to be 'Pong'. those two little paddles and a ball bouncing back and forth.. simpler times eh? question: I just stumbled upon my old Pokemon cards in the loft. You remember Pokemon right? It was such a craze for us - I'd spend days trading and battling them with my school buddies. Got me thinking, what was the big trend you remember being really into as a kid or teenager?

question: I recently bought a CD player for my car because the Bluetooth broke down. I know it's a tad old school but I gotta tell ya, I'm loving it! question: I remember when I was in high school in the late 90s, everyone was freaking out about Y2K, thinking that all the computers were going to crash when the date switched to the year 2000! It feels such a long time ago now, right? Do you remember the millennial bug - Y2K? Did you or anyone you know did anything funny or ridiculous out of fear?

comments.text: haha, oh the Y2K madness! question: It's funny, I was chatting with a friend the other day about how we felt when we got our first cell phones. The excitement of sending my first SMS, the curiosity to play snake - the first ever mobile game I played, the joy of changing the cover to match my mood, ha-ha. What about you? Can you recall your first mobile phone and how you felt when you first got it? What was the most exciting or funniest thing you remember doing with it? comments.text: oh man, your Nokia 3310 story takes me back. my first mobile phone was a Motorola StarTAC – a little flip phone relic of the late 90s. imagine this, i was already in my 30s when mobile phones started becoming commonplace for most folks. that little clamshell felt like i was holding the future in my hand. lot of my pals had those Nokia 3310s though too, playing 'snake' on their lunch break. me, i got a kick out of that tiny green screen, and the novelty of making a call without being tethered to a wall. i even remember feeling all flash at the office giving out my new mobile number, hahaha.

the funniest part was texting though, remember T9 predictive text? man, now there was a real challenge for you. so yeah, the teenagers today, with their iPhones, TikToks, and whatever else, they'd think we were living in the stone age, lol. but hey, stone age or not, we sure did experience a pretty cool part of tech history, didn't we? yeesh, this post really does make me feel like the 55 year old that i am! :D

question: When I was a child, I was completely obsessed with the "Captain Planet" TV show. It was the highlight of my weekends in the early '90s. How about you? Can you recall a show from your childhood that you were particularly fond of? What are some adventures or lessons you learnt from it?

fast forward to today, working in research, staring at piles of equations on the brink of comprehension, quantum computing still fascinates me, yet ironically, it hasn't evolved as fast as our starry-eyed teenage selves thought it would. but hey, the technology's not going anywhere and neither is my enthusiasm for it. sometimes i find it amusing how a bunch of internet forums and reddit threads today still mimic our cafeteria talks from decades ago, just with fancier jargon. oh, good times, good times.

don't get me wrong, I would kill for a PS5 too now lol, especially with all the design details and graphic upgrades, it's a designer's paradise ;)

question: It's crazy how technology evolves man. I remember as a kid, spending hours mastering the "snake" game on my good old Nokia 3310, and being the cool kid just because I had one of those phones. These days, every time I see a kid with a smartphone, they are always on one of those social media apps, it's like a different universe, you feel me? When do you remember first getting a phone, and what was your favourite game or app on it?

comments.text: haha, good times mate! my first tango was with one of those giant PCs, where i spent my youth geeking around on age of empires and later the first sims. phones didn't land in my palms till late 2000s, when i was a student scrambling my way through academia. no games there, just some texts and a whole lot of snake too! tbh, i miss the simplicity. the world wasn't always throwing information on our faces, and sometimes, the daily onslaught of data on reddit just makes me yearn for that old pace again. but hey, can't complain, it keeps the hubby and me entertained most evenings!
